addText.text: Dear participant, Welcome to our study! We are the Crossmodal Research Laboratory, Department of Experimental Psychology, Oxford University. We are interested in understanding how people associate information across the senses. If you decide to take part in this experiment, you will be asked to match colours with taste words and will be asked some questions about your choice and about the colours. There are not right or wrong responses, please respond according to what it feels right to you. We hope you enjoy it. Your participation is very important to us.
When the stimuli have loaded (below bar), please click 'Continue'

addInput.text: what is your native language? Please type your answer into this box.

addText.text: In this study you will be shown a colour or colours in the middle of the screen. Your task is to tell us which taste or taste word (e.g., bitter, sweet, salty or sour) you think goes with that colour(s). We will also ask you how confident you were in your decision, how much you liked the colour(s), and when there is only one colour, how intense you find that colour. There are 24 trials in total.
Please select the taste-word that you feel most represents the colour in the middle of the screen.

addText.text: We need to test that you see the same colours as everyone else who does this experiment (colours can appear differently on different monitors). Please select the appropriate colour word next to each colour shape.

Thank you for your participation to this study. We're exploring the way people associate colours with tastes. If you have any questions or would like to here more about our research, please contact us at andy.woods@psy.ox.ac.uk DO NOT FORGET TO ENTER THE BELOW CODE INTO MECHANICAL TURK.
